attributes.action: Stop airports and airlines charging rip off prices on bottled water
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Passengers are unable to pack bottled water in their hand luggage before they enter the airport due to the liquid restrictions.

Since the liquid restrictions, some airports and airlines are charging way too much for water. One airline charges £3 for a 500ml bottle, for which it probably cost them 30p.

People need to drink more whilst they are flying as they get dehydrated due to pressure and lack of oxygen in the cabin. With dehydration, the blood gets thickened and DVT happens.

If the govt doesn't do this, then someone will die due to DVT as they refused to pay £3 on a bottle of water on principle.
